text:
Using the Batik-Animation-Support I found a strange behaviour with some 
animations. Let them animate a more or less great time, the animation stops and 
then restarts again after a few minutes.
I use animations that trigger themselves in a circle, so that there is an 
infinite loop of (two or three different) animations. Let this animation after 
20 to 60 Minutes the animation will stop. Waiting further about 5 to 10 Minutes 
the animation will start again.

Perhaps this behaviour has something to do with rounding-operations, so that 
the calculation-results run out of limits from time to time. However, this is 
only a suggestion. I don't now, if it's the real cause.

The URL references a message in the batik-users-list (2007-04-25), where I 
posted a small test-application that shows this behaviour. Perhaps you can use 
this, to find a solution for this problem.
creator: florian.pepping@wincor-nixdorf.com

text:
(In reply to comment #0)
> Let this animation after 20 to 60 Minutes the animation will stop.
> Waiting further about 5 to 10 Minutes the animation will start again.

In my particular environment, I'm not being able to reproduce. I recall a couple of recent animation-related fixes which may have helped fixing this one. Are you still able to reproduce it (using the trunk version [1]) or can this be marked fixed?


> Perhaps this behaviour has something to do with rounding-operations, so that 
> the calculation-results run out of limits from time to time. However, this is 
> only a suggestion.

This sounds reasonable. Perhaps this could be a platform-specific issue possibly caused by a JVM bug (which may have been fixed in recent Java versions)?


Version details:
Batik (Squiggle) - 1.8pre (revision 719560)
Java - Sun JRE 1.6.0_10
Operating system - Windows XP SP3


[1] http://xmlgraphics.apache.org/batik/download.cgi#Subversion+repository

Currently, I'm not able to reproduce this bug, too.
I've tested it with several different environments; however the animations are always correct.
Furthermore, the problem with animations leaving fragments seems to be solved too. (I've had a discussion with Andreas Neumann and Thomas DeWeese in January this year)

So from my point of view you can mark this bug as fixed.

Thanks for the investigation you took in this bug.
